cipher_xl3005.cipher_xl3005

Module Contents

Functions

cipher(text, shift, encrypt=True)

Encrypts a given input alphabetical text string.
cipher_xl3005.cipher_xl3005.cipher(text, shift, encrypt=True)

Encrypts a given input alphabetical text string. Parameters (Inputs) ———- text : str

Character input. This is the input text data, to be ciphered. Only uppercase or lowercase characters in the English Alphabet will be successfully ciphered.

shiftint

Integer input. Each English alphabet character will be replaced by another one. This parameter determines the index of alphabets that will replace the ones in the input, by providing the number that the alpabet will shifted by.

encryptbool

Boolean input. If encrypt is True (default value), each alphabet character will be replaced by another alphabet character; the extent of this shift will be dependent on the shift parameter. If encrypt is False, a similar process will happen, and the extent is also dependent on shift. However, when encrypt is False, it also enables decryption, if some output generated by the cipher function is re-entered as input in the cipher function.

str

The ciphered string will be produced as output.

Examples

>>> from cipher_xl3005 import cipher_xl3005
>>> cipher_kl3045.cipher('bob', 1) #encrypt is True by default
'cpc'
>>> from cipher_xl3005 import cipher_xl3005
>>> cipher_kl3045.cipher('fun', 1, encrypt = False) #decryption function
'etm'
>>> from cipher_xl3005 import cipher_xl3005
>>> cipher_xl3005.cipher('b%b', 1) #non-alphabet characters will not be processed
'c%c'
